;Lil Tay，一位年轻的亚洲社交媒体明星，因其脏话视频而走红，已经死了。据多份报道称，她当时 14 岁。

;

;她的家人周三在 Instagram 上分享了一份声明，宣布了这位冉冉升起的说唱歌手的去世消息。

;

;“我们怀着沉重的心情分享这一毁灭性的消息。我们深爱的克莱尔突然悲惨去世的消息，”声明称。

;

;“我们无法用言语来表达难以承受的损失和难以形容的痛苦。这个结果完全出乎我们的意料，让我们所有人都感到震惊。”Instagram 的声明继续说道。 “她哥哥的去世给我们的悲痛增添了难以想象的深度。”

;

;Lil Tay（真名 Claire Hope）在 2018 年因在 Instagram 上发布的炫耀名牌服装和豪华汽车的照片和帖子而走红。在 2018 年 3 月的一段视频中，霍普声称她浴室里的浴缸和马桶“都比你的房租还贵”。

;

;截至周三，这名少女的两部 YouTube 视频 - 一部参观杰克·保罗的家，一部讲述关于她与网络明星说唱歌手 Danielle “Bhad Bhabie” Bregoli 的不和 – 观看次数超过 400 万，她的 Instagram 帐户拥有超过 300 万粉丝。

;

;亚洲儿童说唱歌手 Lil Tay 陷入监护权之争，社交媒体帖子透露

;

;2018 年，这位社交媒体明星吸引了 YouTube 名人杰克·保罗 (Jake Paul)、因菲尔博士 (Dr Phil Phil) 的亮相而走红的布雷戈利 (Bregoli) 和网络名人哇维琪 (Woah Vicky) 的关注。

;

;她的视频也引起了史努比狗狗的注意。但他似乎并不喜欢 Lil Tay 在 2018 年的行为。

;

;“她需要在学校学习如何成为一个小女孩，而不是一个愚蠢的成年人，”他写道互联网明星的视频。

;

;Lil Tay 与家人从加拿大搬到了洛杉矶，她在 2018 年接受《早安美国》节目的 Juju Chang 采访时表示，“没有人强迫我这样做”，而且她母亲 – Angela Tian – 并没有剥削她。

;

;她继续说道：“这是我的决定。我对自己所做的事情感到满意”。

;

;尽管 Lil Tay 在网络上享有盛誉，但 2018 年之后她似乎没有在她的社交媒体帐户上发布更多视频或照片。在她去世之前，这位说唱歌手的最新作品Instagram 帖子是向已故音乐家 XXXTentacion 致敬。

;

;该家族周三发表声明，要求粉丝和社交媒体关注者“在我们对这一巨大损失感到悲痛之际，保护隐私”。声明还表示，这位明星以及她哥哥的死亡“仍在调查中。”

;

;“克莱尔将永远留在我们心中，她的缺席留下了不可替代的空虚，所有人都会感受到谁认识她并爱她，”声明总结道。

; Thu, 10 Aug 2023 08:20:01 +0800 This International Youth Day, let’s celebrate how young people are fighting for a better, more sustainable worldhttps://www.scmp.com/comment/opinion/article/3230382/international-youth-day-lets-celebrate-how-young-people-are-fighting-better-more-sustainable-world?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.10 08:15;
;;

;随着国际青年节的临近，承认和庆祝青年的独特品质至关重要青年人为全球社会做出的贡献和贡献，使世界更加紧密地联系在一起。

;

;2000 年 8 月 12 日庆祝第一个国际青年日，联合国指定该日旨在提高青年人的认识。今年的主题是“青年的绿色技能：迈向可持续发展的世界”。

;

;青年的概念可能很模糊。它通常被归为年龄在 15 至 24 岁之间的群体，这一群体约有 12 亿，占世界人口的 16%。引人注目的是，全球一半以上的人口年龄在 30 岁以下。然而，全世界只有 2.6% 的议员属于这个年龄段。

;

;尽管政治代表性微不足道，但年轻人继续达到在最前沿，采用创新战略来应对从气候危机到技术治理的一系列全球挑战。年轻人有潜力促进积极变革并产生重大影响。

;

;青年网络和社会影响力组织，例如联合国可持续发展解决方案网络、同一个青年世界和全球杰出青年社区，点燃了全球运动和培育新的全球化浪潮。

;

;尽管地缘政治紧张局势和全球宏观经济前景相当严峻 — — 特别是考虑到中美关系的紧张 — — 这些全球青年网络仍准备支持全球化与合作，努力应对应对世界面临的挑战。

;

;包括《福布斯 30 位 30 岁以下精英》在内的多个受人尊敬的组织和提名认可年轻人的成就，认可他们的创业精神和影响力。这种认可刺激了从可再生能源到医疗保健和教育等各个领域的初创企业和创新解决方案的激增。

;

;在推进人道主义议程（例如联合国可持续发展目标）时，世界各地的年轻人世界各地的人都具有创业热情，这有助于推动下一波全球化浪潮。

;

;它鼓励跨境合作和思想交流。许多年轻企业家不仅打造新企业，还通过解决气候变化、贫困和不平等等紧迫问题来促进社会变革并为全球发展做出贡献。

;

;此外，全球青年网络和领导力倡议，例如罗德和苏世民奖学金正在塑造一支具有全球意识和同理心的学者和新兴领导人的骨干队伍，不受地缘政治气候的影响。

;

;能够驾驭全球不确定性、容纳多元化人才并保持中立的网络将出现领导力。

;

;这些多元化的社区体现了通过全球团结和人民力量加速集体行动。他们倡导全球事业，超越国界和对抗，强调超越集团政治和民族主义的合作。

;

;更重要的是，这些网络让年轻的和平建设者参与打击极端主义，并明确将年轻人定位为全球的重要合作伙伴。努力。最后，年轻人的文化敏感性和技术素养将成为具有全球视野的未来公民领袖的重要品质。

;

;年轻人引领下一波全球化浪潮的能力很大程度上取决于他们接触的机会的增加到教育和技术。全球青年识字率大幅上升，追求高等教育的人数比以往任何时候都多。

;

;根据联合国教科文组织去年的一项调查，超过90%的年轻人计划接受高等教育。这一代人的知识越来越丰富，技能越来越熟练，并准备好应对日益互联的世界带来的挑战。

;

;香港的年轻人才是必须战略性培养的力量

;

;作为他们可以说是历史上最精通技术的一代人，他们是伴随着互联网、智能手机和社交媒体长大的，这些正在彻底改变沟通和信息共享。全球超过 85.5% 的人口拥有智能手机，年轻人不断接触不同的文化、语言和观点，这可以培养全球公民意识。

;

;随着世界的发展，这种技术素养将是无价的。变得更加相互联系，使年轻人能够以新的方式进行合作和创新，并比前一代人更加拥抱多样性。当我们经历第四次工业革命时，他们将成为关键的变革推动者。

;

;开放和宽容在下一波全球化浪潮中至关重要，促进跨境、跨代的思想、知识和创新的自由交流。它还将为建设更加包容和公平的全球社会做出贡献，确保所有人享有平等机会。

;长实集团对九龙一个开发项目的房屋定价激进，该项目的价格低于专家表示，香港七年来吸引了大批潜在买家，这并不是灾难性价格战的第一枪，而只是清理库存的明智策略。

;

;开发商，房地产旗舰香港亿万富翁李嘉诚的首席执行官也驳斥了有关其折扣旨在或将引发价格战的说法。

;

;超过 22,000 名潜在买家已存入支票，希望购买 Coast Line 的公寓II 位于油塘，折扣后平均售价为每平方英尺 14,686 港元（1,880 美元）。鉴于大家的反应，长江实业将周六开始的销售范围从 254 个单位扩大到 382 个，最后扩大到全部 626 个可用单位。

;

;“每个开发商都有不同的策略来出售他们的新住宅项目，长江实业香港地产建设商会执行委员会主席梁志坚表示：“我们只是选择通过提供一些折扣来快速出售[这些单位]。”

;

;此举不应该被视为梁说，这对市场来说是一个可怕的预兆，因为开发商仍在赚取可观的利润。 “如果开发商决定降价出售房产，但他们正在亏损，那么就需要恐慌。”

;

;梁和其他专家认为，激进的定价是一种营销手段测试购房者反应并吸引市场关注的策略。这也被视为一门好生意。

;

;“从长远来看，在高利率环境下持有库存对开发商来说并不好，因为[它]意味着每月支付额外的利息，”Eddie Hui说理工大学建筑及环境学院副院长志文。 “如果我以较慢的速度出售[库存]，我的成本就会增加，因此最好更快地出售。”

;

;分析师表示，李嘉诚的长实资产将恢复回购以提振股价

;有顾问表示，长实的大幅折扣将导致其他开发商在第三季度为新盘提供更大的折扣，引发市场对房价进一步下跌的猜测。

;

;“我们总是根据当时的市场情况来定价我们的开发项目，”长江实业执行董事赵国雄告诉《华盛顿邮报》，并补充说较低的价格将使年轻一代有机会拥有自己的住宅或升级自己的住宅。

;

;“每个开发项目都有自己的计算，”邱说，他驳斥了有关折扣可能导致该市主要开发商之间价格战的担忧。 “这不是一个很大的发展，不会改变市场。这是我们口袋里的钱……那我为什么要引发价格战？”

;“每个开发项目都有自己的计算，[海岸线]不是一个很大的开发项目，它不会改变市场，”该高管表示。

;定价水平将带来“不是很多利润，但可观的利润”，他补充道。

;

;整个项目的毛利率约为25％至30％，尽管低于过去几年项目30％至40％的收益率，但这对公司来说仍然是一个合理的利润。银河-联昌证券 (CGS-CIMB Securities) 物业管理董事总经理 Raymond Cheng 表示，该项目的低价不太可能影响整个市场，房地产讲座教授周光荣 (Chau Kwong-Wing) 表示

;

;“之后会发生什么也取决于下一批，以及长江实业或其他开发商的计算，”他说。 “如果所有开发商都遵循这个巨大的折扣，那么对市场的影响当然会相当大，但我认为这种情况不太可能发生。我认为他们会先观察一段时间。”

;

;;

;The first cohort of a new annual US fellowship for the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (Asean) has arrived in Washington to a warm welcome – and a growing debate about how Southeast Asia will balance its relationships with China and the US.

;

;The US–Asean Institute for Rising Leaders Fellowship, announced at a special US-Asean Summit in Washington last year, features 31 mid-career professionals, largely government officials, from all 10 Asean member states.

;

;On the rooftop of the new building housing the Johns Hopkins School of Advanced International Studies (SAIS) – the institutional host of the initiative – US Deputy National Security Adviser John Feiner spoke on Tuesday about the administration's “unprecedented” efforts to engage the region, including the formal upgrading of the US-Asean relationship in November.

;

;“This enhanced diplomatic architecture will ensure that every part of our government continues to pursue ambitious new forms of cooperation with Asean long into the future,” he said, speaking of the new US-Asean “comprehensive strategic partnership”.

;

;Asean has the same level of partnership only with three other states: China, India, Australia. China and Australia were the first to receive the status in 2021.

;

;The United States is “more committed than ever” to helping Asean achieve its vision of a peaceful, free and prosperous region, Feiner said.

;

;As part of a month-long programme that began on July 31, the fellows are engaging with government, academic and private sector actors in a series of meetings and training sessions centred on four themes: emerging technologies, public health, security and climate challenges.

;

;The fellows hail from different parts of their governments and the Asean secretariat, representing backgrounds ranging from trade to health. The Myanmar contingent is the only one that comes from civil society, as the host declined nominees forwarded by the country's ruling military junta.

;

;“Asean centrality” was featured in US President Joe Biden's Indo-Pacific Strategy, released in February 2022, where the administration also said it sought to “shape the strategic environment” in which China operated rather than “change” Beijing.

;

;Xi-Biden meeting dominates Asean, G20 and Apec summit season

;

;Since the special summit in May 2022 where Biden hailed a “new era” in US-Asean ties, the two sides have held and scheduled minister-level meetings on climate, health, transport and women's empowerment – building on long-standing dialogues on economics, defence and foreign affairs.

;

;The US also plans to expand other people-to-people programmes in the next few years, such as doubling the size of the Young Southeast Asian Leaders Initiative – a cultural exchange programme for Southeast Asian professionals under 35 – before 2026.

;

;Observers note that the new “rising leaders” programme is part of the administration's efforts to convince Asean that it seeks to engage the region on its own merits, rather than only in the context of US-China competition and security concerns.

;

;US beats China in soft power and popularity in Southeast Asia: analysis

;

;“The focus on people-to-people ties is sorely needed because sometimes the perception in the region is that the United States is focused squarely on issues related to military diplomacy,” said Andreyka Natalegawa, an associate fellow at the Centre for Strategic and International Studies' Southeast Asia programme.

;

;“Southeast Asian countries have made it very clear that they don't want to choose” between the US and China, he added.

;

;“The current approach by the administration has been not one of forcing countries to choose, but rather one of providing countries options.”

;

;Joshua White, a professor at Johns Hopkins SAIS and the programme's director, noted that the fellowship is distinct from other US-led programmes in that it is fully funded by private donors and run with “full academic independence” – while also receiving logistical support from the White House that provides fellows with high-level access to US officials.

;

;White added that the programme was consciously designed so that it is not oriented around China and rather “around the kinds of policy choices and the kinds of policy partnerships that might be possible between the United States and Asean countries”.

;

;Tuesday's welcome reception also featured remarks by SAIS dean Jim Steinberg; the Cambodian ambassador to the US, Keo Chhea; and Marc Mealy, senior vice-president of the US-Asean Business Council.

;

;Mealy's remarks touched on the pressure to choose sides that Asean actors consistently find themselves in.

;

;“You all will discover, there is a very prominent discourse in our country about US-China,” he said.

;

;“But I think it's in our collective interest if we understand some of the more nuanced perspectives about the US-Southeast Asia relationship, and not just simply fold that relationship into a more dominant narrative around US-China relations.”

;An armed Utah man accused of making threats against US President Joe Biden was shot and killed by FBI agents hours before the president was expected to land in the state Wednesday, authorities said.

;Special agents were trying to serve a warrant on the home of Craig Deleeuw Robertson in Provo, south of Salt Lake City, when the shooting happened at 6.15am, the FBI said in a statement.

;Robertson was armed at the time of the shooting, according to two law enforcement sources who spoke on the condition of anonymity to discuss details of an ongoing investigation.

;

;Robertson posted online Monday that he had heard Biden was coming to Utah and he was planning to dig out a camouflage suit and “clean the dust off the m24 sniper rifle,” according to court documents.

;

;In another post, Robertson refers to himself as a “MAGA Trumper”, a reference to former US president Donald Trump's “Make America Great Again” slogan.

Robertson was charged under seal Tuesday with three felony counts, including making threats against the president, court documents show.

;

;“The time is right for a presidential assassination or two.先是乔，然后是卡马拉！！！”当局表示，罗伯逊在文件中包含的 2022 年 9 月 Facebook 帖子中写道。 No lawyer was immediately listed for Robertson in court documents.

;

;Trump posted what he said was Obama's address – an armed man showed up

;No further details were immediately released about the shooting, which is under review by the FBI.

;

;At the Provo house where the confrontation apparently took place and which is connected with Robertson through public records, law enforcement could be seen Wednesday going in and out and removing items.

;

;A broken window could be seen next to the door and the blinds inside were askew.

;

;The road leading to the house was blocked by police.

;

;The house is just up the street from a meeting house of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, with the Wasatch Mountains rising in the background.

;

;Robertson had a custom woodworking business but did not renew his licence after it expired last year, according to state records. On LinkedIn, Robertson said he worked for 45 years as a structural steel and welding inspector before retiring and starting his business, saying he specialised in “custom designs”.

;On Thursday, he is expected to visit a Veterans Affairs hospital to talk about the Pact Act, which expanded veterans benefits, and hold a re-election fundraiser.

; Thu, 10 Aug 2023 06:20:02 +0800 Fifa Women’s World Cup: lack of female coaches spurs calls for more women in dugoutshttps://www.scmp.com/news/asia/article/3230557/fifa-womens-world-cup-lack-female-coaches-spurs-calls-more-women-dugouts?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.10 05:00;
;;

;The World Cup in Australia and New Zealand has showcased the strides made in women's football on the field in recent years – while exposing the lack of women coaches at all levels of the sport.

;

;As the tournament heads into the quarter-finals, England boss Sarina Wiegman is the only woman left on the touchline.

;

;The first 32-team Women's World Cup began with 12 female coaches.

;

;That is 37.5 per cent, exactly the same as at the World Cup in 2019, when nine of the 24 teams in France had a woman at the helm.

;

;“It is a problem not only on the international stage but at every level in the women's game,” said Randy Waldrum, the American coach of the Nigeria team that lost on penalties to Wiegman's England in the last 16. “We need more women coaching in the sport.”

;

;In England, where women's football is highly professional, five of the 12 teams in the Women's Super League finished last season with a woman manager.

;

;In some other countries, including at the World Cup, women's football has only recently turned professional or even remains an amateur sport.

;

;Many within the game believe that more female coaches will inevitably filter through once women's football has had longer to take hold.

;

;Women's World Cup a difficult learning experience

;

;“There's naturally more male coaches,” Wales manager Gemma Grainger told Sky Sports earlier this year. “The men's game has been professional for much longer, and we see that transfer of male coaches into the women's game, and that's the state we're at in this moment.”

;

;The hope is that the ratio will grow in the coming years, especially if current players convert to coaching when their careers end.

;

;Although the proportion of female coaches at this World Cup is the same as four years ago, there are hints of isolated progress.

;

;Shui Qingxia played for China at the inaugural Women's World Cup in 1991 and was in charge of the team at this edition, becoming the first woman to coach China.

;

;“What we hope is that that balance gets right in the future, and we are working on that, at least in England,” said Wiegman. “And I know in a lot of other countries too, to give opportunities to have more women in the game and hopefully also more coaches in the game.”

;

;Wiegman is the standard-bearer for female managers, having won the European Championship with her native Netherlands in 2017 before taking them to the World Cup final two years later.

;

;She then won the Euro again last year with England.

;

;The Lionesses are favourites to lift the World Cup in Australia and New Zealand, and if they do, Wiegman will be the third woman coach in a row to win it.

;

;The US lifted back-to-back World Cups in 2015 and 2019 under Jill Ellis.

;

;'So proud': Women's World Cup football in New Zealand leads the way for LGBTQ in sport

;

;At the previous three Olympics, Bev Priestman with Canada, Silvia Neid (Germany) and Pia Sundhage (US) have all managed teams to gold.

;

;The 2019 Women's World Cup final was the second, after 2003, to feature a woman in both dugouts.

;

;That will not be repeated this year after Hege Riise's Norway, Inka Grings' Switzerland and Desiree Ellis's South Africa were all beaten in the last 16.

;

;Waldrum, who has spent much of his career coaching women's teams at college level in the US, said there needed to be investment and a change of mindset.

;

;“It is not that men shouldn't be coaching,” said Waldrum, who also had a spell in charge of Trinidad and Tobago.

;

;“I think that if they love the women's game, and they are invested in it, then we should have the opportunity to do it, but certainly we need bigger investment in women and women coaching.”

;

;He said it was also a question of “changing the old boys' club mentality too. That women can coach and can be very effective”.

;

;Jamaica's Lorne Donaldson said that nothing should be read into the dominance of male coaches in the latter stages of this year's tournament.

;
